course_description: Beginner-level technical programming course covering Python fundamentals, including syntax, data types, control structures, and basic algorithms. Develop practical skills through hands-on coding exercises and small projects, ideal for new programmers.
course_overview: This course provides a comprehensive introduction to Python programming for individuals with no prior coding experience. Students will learn core programming concepts such as variables, loops, functions, and data structures through hands-on exercises and real-world examples. The curriculum includes practical applications in data analysis, automation, and web development, enabling learners to build a foundational understanding and apply their knowledge to small projects. By the end of the course, participants will be equipped to write efficient, readable code and troubleshoot common programming issues.
target_audience: Aspiring programmers, students, and professionals with no prior coding experience seeking to learn Python.
prerequisites: Access to a computer with internet connectivity
learning_outcomes: Write simple Python scripts to automate tasks
Explain core programming concepts like variables, loops, and functions
Debug common syntax and logic errors in code
Apply control structures (if-else, for/while loops) to solve problems
Implement functions and modules for reusable code
Read and modify basic Python programs using standard libraries
Create a small project demonstrating understanding of foundational concepts
